suncertify.util
Interface RemoteObservable

All Superinterfaces:
java.rmi.Remote
All Known Subinterfaces:
ContractorManagerRemote
All Known Implementing Classes:
ContractorManagerRemoteImpl, Observable
public interface RemoteObservable
extends java.rmi.Remote

Remote interface for the Observable class.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Lars Kuettner
See Also:
Observable

Method Detail

addObserver

void addObserver(RemoteObserver ob)
                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Adds an observer to the set of observers for an observable object, provided that it is not the same as some observer already in the set. The order in which notifications will be delivered to multiple observers is not specified.

Parameters:
ob - an observer to be added
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the parameter ob is null
java.rmi.RemoteException - on network error
See Also:
Observable.addObserver(Observer)

deleteObserver

void deleteObserver(RemoteObserver ob)
                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Deletes an observer from the set of observers of of an observable object. Passing null to this method will have no effect.

Parameters:
ob - the observer to be deleted
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - on network error
See Also:
Observable.deleteObserver(Observer)

deleteObservers

void deleteObservers()
                     throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Clears the observer list so that the observable object no longer has any observers.

Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - on network error
See Also:
Observable.deleteObservers()

countObservers

int countObservers()
                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Returns the number of observers of an observable object.

Returns:
the number of observers
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - on network error
See Also:
Observable.countObservers()

notifyObservers

void notifyObservers()
                     throws java.rmi.RemoteException
If the observable object has changed, as indicated by the hasChanged method, then notify all of its observers and then call the clearChanged method to indicate that the object has no longer changed.

This method will notify its observers with null as an argument.

Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - on network error
See Also:
Observable.notifyObservers()

notifyObservers

void notifyObservers(java.rmi.Remote r)
                     throws java.rmi.RemoteException
If the observable object has changed, as indicated by the hasChanged method, then notify all of its observers and then call the clearChanged method to indicate that the object has no longer changed.

Notifies observers of a change with the specified remote reference as an argument.

Parameters:
r - the remote object to be passed to the observers
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - on network error
See Also:
Observable.notifyObservers(Object)

notifyObservers

void notifyObservers(java.io.Serializable s)
                     throws java.rmi.RemoteException
If the observable object has changed, as indicated by the hasChanged method, then notify all of its observers and then call the clearChanged method to indicate that the object has no longer changed.

Notifies observers of a change with the specified serializable reference as an argument.

Parameters:
s - the serializable object to be sent to the observers
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - on network error
See Also:
Observable.notifyObservers(Object)

hasChanged

boolean hasChanged()
                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Tests if the observable object has changed.

Returns:
true if and only if the setChanged method has been called more recently than the clearChanged method on the observable object; false otherwise.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - on network error
See Also:
Observable.hasChanged()
